info.game_comments:
2007 College Championship quarterfinal game 5.
From the University of Southern California.

(1, 1).clue: Have long online discussions of how this trilogy's Legolas would fare against Batman

(2, 1).clue: This relative of the squid & cuttlefish is shy & can change its color to hide in the coral

(4, 1).clue: Originally, it was the area that could be plowed by a team of oxen in a morning without tiring them

(5, 1).clue: I crave a Krispy Kreme chicken sandwich: a fried chicken breast served between these

(6, 1).clue: It's common slang for a huge 18-wheeler

(1, 2).clue: The truth was out there, & the geeky "Lone Gunmen" (there were 3) tried to help Mulder find it on this '90s drama

(2, 2).clue: Of the main types of coral reef, this one is miles offshore with a channel between it & the mainland

(4, 2).clue: A unit of commerce, it's 42 gallons of crude oil

(5, 2).clue: I think I'll dunk my Double Stuf version of this Nabisco cookie in milk

(1, 3).clue: You may wonder if Yoda disappeared after dying, why didn't Vader after dying in this 1983 film
(1, 3).correct response: (Star Wars Episode VI:) Return of the Jedi

(2, 3).clue: The largest known living bivalve is a giant one of these reef dwellers; its shell can weigh about 300 pounds

(4, 3).clue: 2 fathoms, the minimum safe clearance for steamboats, inspired this 19th century pen name

(5, 3).clue: I'll refresh myself with tzatziki, a Greek dish made from yogurt & this green gourd

(1, 4).clue: Be proud if you know "Resistance is futile" is the staple phrase of this "Star Trek" race

(2, 4).clue: The skeletons of coral polyps are made of calcium carbonate, so coral reefs are mainly this sedimentary rock

(4, 4).clue: The Greek letter omega is the symbol for this unit of electrical resistance

(5, 4).clue: I'm going to make Rice Krispies Treats; I've got butter, Rice Krispies & 4 cups of miniature these

(6, 4).clue: A query about the process by which food is broken down, absorbed & assimilated by the body

(1, 5).clue: You could quote Princess Irulan's line "The planet is Arrakis, also known as" this title

(2, 5).clue: There's a fungus among us with this type of coral seen here

(4, 5).clue: This country once used a Cape foot, which was .314858 meters

(5, 5).clue: I'll have 2 of Chicken of the Sea's new Peel & Eat Cups: cajun tuna & skinless boneless pink this

(6, 5).clue: Debacle following the spilling of McIlhenny's famous hot sauce

(1, 1).clue: "Energy is never created or destroyed" is one way of stating the law of this "of energy"

(2, 1).clue: "Everybody Loves" this first name that means "mighty protector"

(3, 1).clue: This director's films, like "North by Northwest", often have a wrongly accused hero

(4, 1).clue: The rise & fall of ocean waters loses a D & transforms into neckwear

(5, 1).clue: Strom Thurmond has a wellness & fitness center named for him at this school, the other USC

(6, 1).clue: This strait entering the Aegean may be named for Troy's founder, Dardanus

(1, 2).clue: In 1912 experiments by Max von Laue established that X-rays are not particles but these

(2, 2).clue: Real first name of U.S. president Grover Cleveland; it was also that of Texas pioneer Austin

(3, 2).clue: Even dead-broke students should avoid staying in this title establishment of a gory 2005 film

(4, 2).clue: Mr. Roddick's first name thinks the D is passe, so out it goes & it becomes a word for "some"

(5, 2).clue: As a midshipman, Ross Perot was elected president--not of the U.S., but of his class at this school

(6, 2).clue: The greatest of the Trojan warriors, he's killed by the greatest of the Greek warriors

(1, 3).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew performs an experiment.)  I'll put a coin in the bowl, but you won't be able to see it until I pour in water, which causes this, from the Latin for "to break"

(2, 3).clue: First name of Britain's Commissioner of Works in 1856; a bell was named for him

(3, 3).clue: Several cardiectomies are performed in "Apocalypto", set in this civilization

(4, 3).clue: She's wearing her white dress, about to be married... Oh no!  No D, & she's now a soft white cheese

(5, 3).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew reports from a college campus.)  Luckily, spelling the name of this school's Coach Krzyzewski isn't a requirement for admission

(6, 3).clue: Seen here is Achilles slaying Penthesilea, queen of these warriors who fought for the Trojans

(1, 4).clue: An "electric eye" alarm detects a break in the beam of light not with a simple "electric" cell but with this type of cell

(2, 4).clue: Henry VIII married 3 women with this first name

(3, 4).clue: In this Clive Owen movie, the human race has stopped having kids

(4, 4).clue: Another name for Satan, after losing a D, shows its true colors & gets truly wicked

(5, 4).clue: A 7-foot statue of this colonial statesman overlooks the campus of GMU, the university named for him

(6, 4).clue: This son of Priam was raised as a shepherd after his mom learned in a vision he would cause the fall of Troy

(1, 5).clue: Electromotive force, or EMF, is energy put out per unit of charge put in; this is its basic unit of measure

(2, 5).clue: First name of pollster Gallup & 19th century U.S. VP Clinton

(3, 5).clue: He won a 1990 Oscar not for acting but for directing "Dances with Wolves"

(4, 5).clue: A vertical blade that steers a ship sets one D adrift & acts more discourteous

(5, 5).clue: This Quebecois began teaching law at the University of Montreal in 1961 & became Canada's P.M. 7 years later

(6, 5).clue: The rose seen here shares its name with this Trojan woman, who deserted her lover for Diomedes

(0, 0).clue: In 1887 this artist tried living in Panama & worked on the canal before the U.S. got involved
